title: How to Make a Flemish Carbonnade

steps.headline: Slice the onions and bake them in a skillet until they are soft.
steps.description: Don't brown them yet as this can burn them later.

steps.headline: Add the meat and sear it.
Season with pepper and salt and add the bay leaf, thyme and clove.
Place a lid on the skillet and let it simmer on a low fire for about an hour.
Add the water and the Belgian beer.
Spread the mustard on the slice of white bread and place it on top of the meat.
steps.description: This will help to flavor the meat and thicken the sauce.

steps.headline: Cook it without a lid until the meat is falling apart and the sauce is thick.
steps.description: Check regularly if the stew isn't burning, if it's starting to overcook add some water or some more beer to the stew.

steps.headline: Serve with fries or potatoes and a salad on the side.

text: Slice the onions and bake them in a skillet until they are soft. Don't brown them yet as this can burn them later. Add the meat and sear it.  Season with pepper and salt and add the bay leaf, thyme and clove.  Place a lid on the skillet and let it simmer on a low fire for about an hour.  Add the water and the Belgian beer.  Spread the mustard on the slice of white bread and place it on top of the meat. This will help to flavor the meat and thicken the sauce. Cook it without a lid until the meat is falling apart and the sauce is thick. Check regularly if the stew isn't burning, if it's starting to overcook add some water or some more beer to the stew. Serve with fries or potatoes and a salad on the side.  Finished.
